questions_1.question: Identify the components of the fuel distribution system?
Options: The heat exchanger, N1 Sensor, Fuel Pump, MFC
The fuel filter, MFC, Fuel Injectors, Heat Exchanger
The fuel manifold, MFC, P3 sensor, Fuel Pump
The air injectors, Fuel manifold, Fuel flow meter, MFC
questions_1.correctFeedback:
That's Correct!

You have chosen the correct option.
questions_1.InCorrectFeedback:
That's Incorrect!

You have chosen the wrong option. The valid answer is "The fuel filter, MFC, Fuel Injectors, Heat Exchanger"
questions_1.FirstInCorrectFeedback: Incorrect! Try again. The accessory gearbox

questions_2.question: Which of the following is NOT a function of pressurized fuel?
Options: Increasing parassitic airflow pressure
Actuation of the VG system
Cooling of the engine oil
Motive flow for the aircraft’s fuel boost ejector pumps
questions_2.correctFeedback:
That's Correct!

You have chosen the correct option.
questions_2.InCorrectFeedback:
That's Incorrect!

You have chosen the wrong option. The valid answer is "Increasing parassitic airflow pressure"
questions_2.FirstInCorrectFeedback: Incorrect! Try again. lube and scavenge pump.

questions_3.question: How many pump stages are in the fuel pump?
questions_3.correctFeedback:
That's Correct!

You have chosen the correct option.
questions_3.InCorrectFeedback:
That's Incorrect!

You have chosen the wrong option. The valid answer is "3"
questions_3.FirstInCorrectFeedback: Incorrect! Try again. forward right side of the AGB.

questions_4.question: The fuel pump is mounted on the aft side of the
Options: accessory gearbox (AGB).
lube and scavenge pump.
fuel/oil heat exchanger.
A-sump scavenge pump.
questions_4.correctFeedback:
That's Correct!

You have chosen the correct option.
questions_4.InCorrectFeedback:
That's Incorrect!

You have chosen the wrong option. The valid answer is "accessory gearbox (AGB)."
questions_4.FirstInCorrectFeedback: Incorrect! Try again. A, B and C

questions_5.question: The secondary main pump element in the CF34-3 engine fuel pump functions to:
Options: provide high pressure fuel flow to the fuel control at low power settings
provide high pressure fuel flow to the fuel control at all power settings
provide motive flow back to aircraft tanks to run ejector boost pumps
increase pump inlet pressure, so fuel can be routed externally to the heat exchanger and fuel filter, then back to the pump
questions_5.correctFeedback:
That's Correct!

You have chosen the correct option.
questions_5.InCorrectFeedback:
That's Incorrect!

You have chosen the wrong option. The valid answer is "provide motive flow back to aircraft tanks to run ejector boost pumps"
questions_5.FirstInCorrectFeedback: Incorrect! Try again. holds the fan rotor and the forward end of the fan shaft.

questions_6.question: The fuel pump provides the
Options: N2 input signal to the main fuel control.
N1 input signal to the main fuel control.
T2 input signal to the main fuel control.
T2c input signal to the main fuel control.
questions_6.correctFeedback:
That's Correct!

You have chosen the correct option.
questions_6.InCorrectFeedback:
That's Incorrect!

You have chosen the wrong option. The valid answer is "N2 input signal to the main fuel control."

questions_7.question: The fuel filter is mounted at
Options: approx 11 o’clock position on the compressor casing, just aft of the lubricating oil tank.
approx 1 o’clock position on the compressor casing, just aft of the lubricating oil tank.
approx 5 o’clock position on the compressor casing, just forward of the lubricating oil tank.
approx 7 o’clock position on the compressor casing, just forward of the lubricating oil tank.
questions_7.correctFeedback:
That's Correct!

You have chosen the correct option.
questions_7.InCorrectFeedback:
That's Incorrect!

You have chosen the wrong option. The valid answer is "approx 11 o’clock position on the compressor casing, just aft of the lubricating oil tank."

questions_8.question: The fuel filter assembly provides the
Options: fuel volume indication to the flight deck.
fuel pressure indication to the flight deck.
fuel temperature indication to the flight deck.
fuel quantity indication to the flight deck
questions_8.correctFeedback:
That's Correct!

You have chosen the correct option.
questions_8.InCorrectFeedback:
That's Incorrect!

You have chosen the wrong option. The valid answer is "fuel temperature indication to the flight deck."
questions_8.FirstInCorrectFeedback: Incorrect! Try again. There is no indication of actual bypass

questions_9.question: When the red-colored fuel bypass warning button on the fuel filter pops up, this indicates:
Options: An impending bypass is about to occur
Fuel icing
A filter bypass has occured
Normal operation
questions_9.correctFeedback:
That's Correct!

You have chosen the correct option.
questions_9.InCorrectFeedback:
That's Incorrect!

You have chosen the wrong option. The valid answer is "A filter bypass has occured"
questions_9.FirstInCorrectFeedback: Incorrect! Try again. top forward side of the AGB.

questions_10.question: Which of the following is true for the fuel filters supplied by Grimes Aerospace and Pall Aerospace?
Options: The fuel bowl manufactured by one vendor will not assemble with the filter housing manufactured by the other vendor.
The fuel bowl manufactured by one vendor will assemble with the filter housing manufactured by the other vendor.
The fuel bowl manufactured by Grimes Aerospace will not assemble with the filter housing manufactured by Pall Aerospace.
The fuel bowl manufactured by Pall Aerospace will not assemble with the filter housing manufactured by Grimes Aerospace.
questions_10.correctFeedback:
That's Correct!

You have chosen the correct option.
questions_10.InCorrectFeedback:
That's Incorrect!

You have chosen the wrong option. The valid answer is "The fuel bowl manufactured by one vendor will not assemble with the filter housing manufactured by the other vendor."

questions_11.question: The main fuel control is installed aft of the
Options: fuel pump.
fuel manifolds.
fuel/oil heat exchanger.
ITT indicating system.
questions_11.correctFeedback:
That's Correct!

You have chosen the correct option.
questions_11.InCorrectFeedback:
That's Incorrect!

You have chosen the wrong option. The valid answer is "fuel pump."
questions_11.FirstInCorrectFeedback: Incorrect! Try again. lube and scavenge pump and sends filtered oil to the fuel/oil heat exchanger.

questions_12.question: The main fuel control supplies metered fuel to the
Options: fuel pump.
fuel manifold.
fuel/oil heat exchanger.
servo fuel heater.

That's Correct!

You have chosen the correct option.
questions_12.InCorrectFeedback:
That's Incorrect!

You have chosen the wrong option. The valid answer is "fuel manifold."
questions_12.FirstInCorrectFeedback: Incorrect! Try again. oil filter module.

questions_13.question: The fuel manifold consists of two separate, semi circular halves of tubing that are attached together
Options: with C-nuts at 7 o’clock and 5 o’clock positions to form one continuous ring.
with B-nuts at 7 o’clock and 6 o’clock positions to form one continuous ring.
with A-nuts at 12 o’clock and 5 o’clock positions to form one continuous ring.
with B-nuts at 12 o’clock and 6 o’clock positions to form one continuous ring.
questions_13.correctFeedback:
That's Correct!

You have chosen the correct option.
questions_13.InCorrectFeedback:
That's Incorrect!

You have chosen the wrong option. The valid answer is "with B-nuts at 12 o’clock and 6 o’clock positions to form one continuous ring."
questions_13.FirstInCorrectFeedback: Incorrect! Try again. Vents the air overboard through a vent tube located on the alternator stator housing.

questions_14.question: How many fuel injectors are on each engine?
questions_14.correctFeedback:
That's Correct!

You have chosen the correct option.
questions_14.InCorrectFeedback:
That's Incorrect!

You have chosen the wrong option. The valid answer is "18"

questions_15.question: Which fuel injector located near the MFC at approx 8 o’clock position on the engine, has a horizontal orientation?
Options: No. 1 fuel injector
No. 13 fuel injector
No. 12 fuel injector
No. 10 fuel injector

That's Correct!

You have chosen the correct option.
questions_15.InCorrectFeedback:
That's Incorrect!

You have chosen the wrong option. The valid answer is "No. 13 fuel injector"

questions_16.question: When the fuel differential pressure between the manifold and combustion chamber:
Options: reduces below approx 50 psid, the primary check valve closes and prevents the fuel from dripping into the combustion liner.
reduces below approx 18 psid, the primary check valve opens.
reduces below approx 20 psid, the primary check valve closes and prevents the fuel from dripping into the combustion liner.
reduces below approx 10 psid, the primary check valve opens.
questions_16.correctFeedback:
That's Correct!

You have chosen the correct option.
questions_16.InCorrectFeedback:
That's Incorrect!

You have chosen the wrong option. The valid answer is "reduces below approx 20 psid, the primary check valve closes and prevents the fuel from dripping into the combustion liner."
questions_16.FirstInCorrectFeedback: Incorrect! Try again. 5 psi pressure in the reservoir.
